step.context: \textbf{Check Point\#1: }\text{Is the following function}\\ \text{defined and continuous in }\left[0 , \dfrac{\pi}{4}\right]?
step.tex: \text{Yes.}\sin 2x \text{ is simply the sine function which is }\\ \text{defined and continuous for all x }
step.reason: \int_{a}^{b} f \left(x\right).dx \text{ makes sense only if }f \left(x\right) \text{ is defined}\\ \text{and continuous in }\left[0,\dfrac{\pi}{4}\right],\text{for example}\\ \int_{-\dfrac{\pi}{4}}^{\dfrac{\pi}{4}} \dfrac{dx}{\sin 2x}\text{ is not defined because }\dfrac{1}{\sin 2x}\text{ is}\\ \text{discontinuous at }x = 0. \in \left[-\dfrac{\pi}{4},\dfrac{\pi}{4}\right].
